../src/lowrisc_ip_rv_core_ibex_0.1/lint/rv_core_ibex.vlt Cov: 0% 

   1: // Copyright lowRISC contributors.
   2: // Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0, see LICENSE for details.
   3: // SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0
   4: 
   5: // Lint waivers for Verilator
   6: // See https://www.veripool.org/projects/verilator/wiki/Manual-verilator#CONFIGURATION-FILES
   7: // for documentation.
   8: //
   9: // Important: This file must included *before* any other Verilog file is read.
  10: // Otherwise, only global waivers are applied, but not file-specific waivers.
  11: 
  12: `verilator_config
  13: lint_off -rule PINCONNECTEMPTY
  14: 
  15: // Operator expects 1 bit on initial value but initial value's CONST generates
  16: // 32 bits
  17: lint_off -rule WIDTH -file "*/rtl/ibex_core_tracing.sv" -match "*'RV32M'*"
  18: lint_off -rule WIDTH -file "*/rtl/ibex_core_tracing.sv" -match "*'RV32E'*"
  19: lint_off -rule WIDTH -file "*/rtl/ibex_core_tracing.sv" -match "*'RV32B'*"
  20: lint_off -rule WIDTH -file "*/rtl/ibex_core_tracing.sv" -match "*'BranchTargetALU'*"
  21: lint_off -rule WIDTH -file "*/rtl/ibex_core_tracing.sv" -match "*'WritebackStage'*"
  22: lint_off -rule WIDTH -file "*/rtl/ibex_core_tracing.sv" -match "*'SecureIbex'*"
  23: lint_off -rule WIDTH -file "*/rtl/ibex_core_tracing.sv" -match "*'PMPEnable'*"
  24: 
  25: // Filename 'ibex_register_file_ff' does not match MODULE name: ibex_register_file
  26: // ibex_register_file_ff and ibex_register_file_latch provide two
  27: // implementation choices for the same module.
  28: lint_off -rule DECLFILENAME -file "*/rtl/ibex_register_file_ff.sv"
  29: lint_off -rule DECLFILENAME -file "*/rtl/ibex_register_file_latch.sv"
  30: lint_off -rule DECLFILENAME -file "*/rtl/ibex_register_file_fpga.sv"
  31: 
  32: // Bits of signal are not used: shift_amt_compl[5]
  33: // cleaner to write all bits even if not all are used
  34: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_alu.sv" -match "*'shift_amt_compl'[5]*"
  35: 
  36: // Bits of signal are not used: shift_result_ext[32]
  37: // cleaner to write all bits even if not all are used
  38: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_alu.sv" -match "*'shift_result_ext'[32]*"
  39: 
  40: // Signal is not used for RV32B == 0: imd_val_q_i
  41: //
  42: // No ALU multicycle instructions exist to use the intermediate value register,
  43: // if bitmanipulation extension is not enabled.
  44: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_alu.sv" -match "*'imd_val_q_i'"
  45: 
  46: // Bits of signal are not used: fetch_addr_n[0]
  47: // cleaner to write all bits even if not all are used
  48: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_if_stage.sv" -match "*'fetch_addr_n'[0]*"
  49: 
  50: // Bits of signal are not used: alu_adder_ext_i[0]
  51: // Bottom bit is round, not needed
  52: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_multdiv_fast.sv" -match "*'alu_adder_ext_i'[0]*"
  53: 
  54: // Bits of signal are not used: mac_res_ext[34], mult1_res[33:32]
  55: // cleaner to write all bits even if not all are used
  56: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_multdiv_fast.sv" -match "*mac_res_ext*"
  57: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_multdiv_fast.sv" -match "*mult1_res*"
  58: 
  59: // Bits of signal are not used: res_adder_h[32]
  60: // cleaner to write all bits even if not all are used
  61: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_multdiv_fast.sv" -match "*'res_adder_h'[32]*"
  62: 
  63: // Bits of signal are not used: be_i[3:1]
  64: // Bits of signal are not used: addr_i[31:10,1:0]
  65: // Bits of signal are not used: wdata_i[31:8]
  66: //
  67: // simulator_ctrl exposes a 32-bit write-only interface to its control
  68: // registers, but actually only looks at the bottom byte and rounds addresses
  69: // down to be 4-byte aligned.
  70: //
  71: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/sim/simulator_ctrl.sv" -match "*'be_i'[3:1]*"
  72: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/sim/simulator_ctrl.sv" -match "*'addr_i'[31:10,1:0]*"
  73: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/sim/simulator_ctrl.sv" -match "*'wdata_i'[31:8]*"
  74: 
  75: // Bits of signal are not used: timer_addr_i[31:10]
  76: //
  77: // The upper bits of this address are used to select whether the timer is
  78: // addressed at all (encoded in the timer_req_i input). However, we pass the
  79: // entire 32-bit address around to make the code a bit cleaner.
  80: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/timer.sv" -match "*'timer_addr_i'[31:10]*"
  81: 
  82: // Bits of signal are not used for MHPMCounterNum < 29: mhpmcounter_we[31:MHPMCounterNum+3]
  83: // cleaner to write all bits even if not all are used
  84: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_cs_registers.sv" -match "*'mhpmcounter_we'[31:MHPMCounterNum+3]*"
  85: 
  86: // Bits of signal are not used: mhpmcounter_we[1]
  87: // Bits of signal are not used: mhpmcounterh_we[1]
  88: // Bits of signal are not used: mhpmcounter_incr[1]
  89: //
  90: // cleaner to write all bits even if not all are used
  91: //
  92: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_cs_registers.sv" -match "*'mhpmcounter_we'[1]*"
  93: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_cs_registers.sv" -match "*'mhpmcounterh_we'[1]*"
  94: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_cs_registers.sv" -match "*'mhpmcounter_incr'[1]*"
  95: 
  96: // Signals are unused if MHPMCounterNum == 0: clk_i, rst_ni
  97: // Signal is unused if MHPMCounterNum == 0: counter_val_i[31:0]
  98: //
  99: // If no counters are implemented, no flops are elaborated. No clock, reset or
 100: // next-state logic is used.
 101: //
 102: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_counters.sv" -match "*'clk_i'"
 103: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_counters.sv" -match "*'rst_ni'"
 104: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_counters.sv" -match "*'counter_val_i'"
 105: 
 106: // Bits of signal are not used for MHPMCounterNum < 29: counter_inc_i[28:MHPMCounterNum]
 107: // Bits of signal are not used for MHPMCounterNum < 29: counterh_we_i[28:MHPMCounterNum]
 108: // Bits of signal are not used for MHPMCounterNum < 29: counter_we_i[28:MHPMCounterNum]
 109: //
 110: // cleaner to write all bits even if not all are used
 111: //
 112: // lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_counters.sv" -match "*'counter_inc_i'[28:*]*"
 113: // lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_counters.sv" -match "*'counterh_we_i'[28:*]*"
 114: // lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_counters.sv" -match "*'counter_we_i'[28:*]*"
 115: 
 116: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_counters.sv" -match "*counter_inc_i*"
 117: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_counters.sv" -match "*counterh_we_i*"
 118: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_counters.sv" -match "*counter_we_i*"
 119: 
 120: // Bits of signal are not used for MHPMCounterWidth < 64: counter_upd[63:MHPMCounterWidth]
 121: // Bits of signal are not used for MHPMCounterWidth < 64: counter_load[63:MHPMCounterWidth]
 122: //
 123: // cleaner to write all bits even if not all are used
 124: //
 125: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_counters.sv" -match "*'counter_upd'[63:*]*"
 126: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_counters.sv" -match "*'counter_load'[63:*]*"
 127: 
 128: // Signal is not used: test_en_i
 129: // testability signal
 130: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_register_file_ff.sv" -match "*test_en_i*"
 131: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_register_file_fpga.sv" -match "*test_en_i*"
 132: 
 133: // Signal is not used: clk_i
 134: // leaving clk and reset connected in-case we want to add assertions
 135: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_pmp.sv" -match "*clk_i*"
 136: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_compressed_decoder.sv" -match "*clk_i*"
 137: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_decoder.sv" -match "*clk_i*"
 138: 
 139: // Signal is not used: rst_ni
 140: // leaving clk and reset connected in-case we want to add assertions
 141: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_pmp.sv" -match "*rst_ni*"
 142: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_compressed_decoder.sv" -match "*rst_ni*"
 143: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_decoder.sv" -match "*rst_ni*"
 144: 
 145: // Bits of signal are not used: instr_alu[24:15,11:7]
 146: // instr flops are duplicated to reduce fan-out, neater to just leave unused
 147: // bits in fully duplicated instr for synthesiser to optimise out rather than
 148: // explicitly flopping only the bits we want.
 149: lint_off -rule UNUSED -file "*/rtl/ibex_decoder.sv" -match "*instr_alu*"
 150: 
 151: // Signal unoptimizable: Feedback to clock or circular logic:
 152: // ibex_core.cs_registers_i.mie_q
 153: // Issue lowrisc/ibex#212
 154: lint_off -rule UNOPTFLAT -file "*/rtl/ibex_cs_registers.sv" -match "*ibex_core.cs_registers_i.mie_q*"
 155: 
 156: // Temporary waivers until OpenTitan primitives are lint-clean
 157: // https://github.com/lowRISC/opentitan/issues/2313
 158: lint_off -file "*/lowrisc_prim_*/rtl/*.sv"
 159:
